com.opengamma.strata.calc.marketdata

Interface CalculationMarketData

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultCalculationMarketData

    public interface CalculationMarketData
    A source of market data provided to an engine function and used for a calculation across multiple scenarios.

    The set of data provided by this interface is a subset of the set provided by CalculationEnvironment. For example a function might request a USD discounting curve, but the scenario market data can contain multiple curve groups, each with a USD discounting curve.

    Typically a set of MarketDataRules are used to choose the item of market data from the global set.

    The standard implementation is DefaultCalculationMarketData.

      • getScenarioValue

        default <T,U extends ScenarioMarketDataValue<T>> U getScenarioValue(ScenarioMarketDataKey<T,U> key)
        Gets an object containing market data for multiple scenarios.

        There are many possible ways to store scenario market data for a data type. For example, if the single values are doubles, the scenario value might simply be a List<Double> or it might be a wrapper class that stores the values more efficiently in a double[].

        If the market data contains a single value for the key or a scenario value of the wrong type, a value of the required type is created by invoking ScenarioMarketDataKey.createScenarioValue(com.opengamma.strata.basics.market.MarketDataBox<T>, int).

        Normally this should not be necessary. It is assumed the required scenario values will be created by the perturbations that create scenario data. However there is no mechanism in the market data system to guarantee that scenario values of a particular type are available. If they are not they are created on demand.

        Values returned from this method might be cached for efficiency.

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the individual market data values used when performing calculations for one scenario
        U - the type of the object containing the market data for all scenarios
        Parameters:
        key - identifies the market data required
        Returns:
        an object containing market data for multiple scenarios
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no value is found

      • containsTimeSeries

        boolean containsTimeSeries(ObservableKey key)
        Checks if this set of data contains a time-series for the specified key.
        Parameters:
        key - the key identifying the item of market data
        Returns:
        true if this set of data contains a time-series of market data for the specified key

      • getTimeSeries

        LocalDateDoubleTimeSeries getTimeSeries(ObservableKey key)
        Gets the time-series identified by the specified key, empty if not found.

        Time series are not affected by scenarios, therefore there is a single time-series for each key which is shared between all scenarios.

        Parameters:
        key - the key identifying the item of market data
        Returns:
        the time-series, empty if no time-series found
